avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 25 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1500 m. More recent wind slabs are covered with new snow and therefore difficult to recognise.
As the snowfall becomes more intense the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase. Towards the evening danger level 4 (high) will be reached above the tree line.
In particular from starting zones at higher altitudes and on steep slopes large dry avalanches are possible.
Backcountry touring calls for caution and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As the precipitation becomes more intense the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent towards the evening.

snowpackStructure.comment:
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
In some places new snow is lying on a hard crust. The new snow will become increasingly prone to triggering.
As a consequence of snowfall and the southeasterly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form.
The meteorological conditions will cause a gradual rise in the danger of dry avalanches in the afternoon.

tendency.comment: The avalanche danger will increase. This applies in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 25 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1500 m. More recent wind slabs are covered with new snow and therefore difficult to recognise.
Not yet all starting zones have released the snow entirely. In particular in the regions with a lot of snow and above the tree line more large dry avalanches are possible.
As the snowfall becomes more intense the prevalence and size of the avalanche prone locations will increase. Towards the evening danger level 4 (high) will be reached above the tree line.
The current avalanche situation calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Gradual increase in avalanche danger as the precipitation becomes more intense.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In all altitude zones a lot of snow is already lying. As a consequence of snowfall and the southeasterly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form.
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
The new snow will become increasingly prone to triggering. The meteorological conditions will cause a gradual rise in the danger of dry avalanches in the afternoon.

tendency.comment: The avalanche danger will increase. This applies in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area over a wide area 20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 1500 m. More recent wind slabs are covered with new snow and therefore difficult to recognise.
As a consequence of new snow and southeasterly wind, further wind slabs will form.
In particular in the regions exposed to precipitation and above the tree line more medium-sized to large dry avalanches are possible. They can occur in particular in starting zones where previous releases have taken place.
Above the tree line and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain the avalanche situation is dangerous. Experience and restraint are required.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent towards the evening. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation this applies especially.

snowpackStructure.comment:
A lot of snow is lying at intermediate and high altitudes.
As a consequence of snowfall and the southeasterly wind, fresh snow drift accumulations will form.
In some places new snow is lying on a hard crust. The new snow will become increasingly prone to triggering.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack.
The meteorological conditions will cause a gradual rise in the danger of dry avalanches in the afternoon.

tendency.comment: The avalanche danger will increase. This applies in particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation.
